questions.question: A can do a work in 10 days and B can do the same work in 15 days. In how many days they can complete the work together?
questions.explanation: A's one day work = 1/10, B's one day work = 1/15. Together one day work = 1/10 + 1/15 = (3+2)/30 = 1/6. So total days = 6

questions.question: If 6 men can do a piece of work in 12 days, in how many days will 9 men do the same work?
questions.explanation: Using M1D1 = M2D2, where M is men and D is days: 6 × 12 = 9 × D2 ⇒ D2 = (6 × 12)/9 = 8 days

questions.question: A can finish a work in 18 days working 8 hours a day. How many hours a day should he work to finish it in 12 days?
questions.explanation: Total work = 18 days × 8 hours = 144 hours. To complete in 12 days: Hours per day = 144/12 = 12 hours

questions.question: If 15 workers can build a wall in 48 hours, how many workers will be needed to build it in 30 hours?
A and B together can do a piece of work in 8 days. If A alone can do it in 12 days, in how many days can B alone do it?
questions.explanation: A's one day work = 1/12, B's one day work = 1/x. Together one day work = 1/8. So, 1/12 + 1/x = 1/8 ⇒ x = 24 days
